fields.title: Staff Parameters General
fields.text:
Parameters cannot be edited once a session has been started

Number of Parts: Number of parts in each session. Each part has definable settings and groups.

Number of Periods: Number of periods in each part. Players stay in the same group for all periods.

Period Length: The length of each period in seconds before the player gets a warning about continuing.

Label Set Count: Number of label sets. A label set is assigned to each player for each part.

Show Instructions: Stop between each part to show instructions.

Test Mode: Enable robot testers for each player.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Outcomes
fields.text:
These are the possible outcomes for the images, label assignments, and reports the player makes.

Name: Name of the outcome.

Abbreviation: Abbreviation of the outcome.

Image File: Image file name. This must be uploaded manually to the server.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Control
fields.text:
Download Parameter Set: Download the parameter set into a file JSON format.  This is primarily useful for moving parameter sets between servers.
 
Upload Parameter Set: Take a JSON formatted file from the above download and load those parameters in.  There is limited validation during this process.  The downloaded file is not intended to be edited.  Parameter edits should be done with the forms on this page.
 
Import Parameter Set: Copy the parameters from another session into this one.  This is the recommended way of setting up a new session.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Parts
fields.text:
Each part has an independent set of parameters.

Mode: 

  • A: All players are in the same group. They are paid the choice majority payment is all of the choices for every period are in the majority. Otherwise, they earn the choice minority payment. The players will see a results screen immediately after mode A parts.
  • B: Players can be divided up into smaller groups. If their label is in the majority, they earn the label majority payment. Otherwise, they earn the label minority payment. 
  • C: Players can be divided up into smaller groups. If their label is in the majority, they earn the label majority payment. Otherwise, they earn the label minority payment. If their report is the majority they earn the choice majority payment. 
  • Notes: The experimenter will choose which mode B and C periods the subject is paid for at the end of the session. The players will see a results screen at the end of the session for all mode B and C parts.

Instructions: The instruction set that is shown to the players before the start of the part. Instruction sets are defined in the admin panel.

Minimum for Majority: The minimum number of players that must be in agreement to be considered for a majority payment.

Pay if

  • Report in Majority: If the player's report is in the majority reported, they are paid this.
  • Report in Minority: If the player's report is not the majority reported, they are paid this.
  • Label in Majority: If the player's label is in the majority reported, they are paid this.
  • Label in Minority: If the player's label is not the majority reported, they are paid this.
  • Notes: Payment rules follow those specified in the mode section.

Period Image: The image, defined in the outcome section, that is shown to all subjects at the top of their screen during that period in that part.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Label Sets
fields.text:
A label set is assigned to each player for each part. Labels are visible to group members in modes B and C. Labels are ignored in mode A.

Name: Identifying name for label set, this is not visible to players.

Period: One of the outcomes that are assigned to players this period.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Players
fields.text:
Each player is assigned a label set and group for each period. In mode A, groups and label sets are ignored.

Label Set: A label set that is defined in the label set frame. Label sets can be reused as many times as needed.

Group: In modes B and C, players with the same group interact with each other. In mode A all players are in the same group.

fields.title: Staff Subject List
fields.text:
Table

Client #:  Each client is numbered from 1 to 24.

Name: Subject's full name.

Student ID: Subject's student id number.

Email: Email address to send private invitation links to.

Earnings: Earnings in USD up to this point in the experiment.

ID Label: Subject's in-experiment ID that is visible to other subjects.

Type: One of the four different subject types.

First Good House: Amount of first good subject has in their house.

Second Good House: Amount of second good subject has in their house.

Third Good House: Amount of third good subject has in their house if applicable.

First Good Field: Amount of first good subject has in their field.

Second Good Field: Amount of second good subject has in their field.

Shareable Log-In Link: Unique link that can be shared with subjects to log in as this client.

Connected: Connection status of client to the experiment.

Instruction: During the instruction phase, shows the current instruction status for the subject.

 

Login

Next available connection: Log in as the next available client that has not Connected.  Note that a subject could log in multiple times by opening this link in multiple windows. This link will auto-forward to the Shareable Log-In Link defined above.

Login by client number: Log in as specified client by number.  Replace "[client_number]" in the link with the desired client number ranging from 1 to 24.  Note that subject could log in as any client by changing the client_number. This link will auto-forward to the Shareable Log-In Link defined above.

 

Controls

Upload Email list: Enter a TAB, comma, and/or carriage return-separated list that will be loaded sequentially into the clients.  

Copy Earnings: Copy Student IDs and Earnings to the clipboard in an ESI Recruiter-compatible format.

Anonymize Data: Once the payments have been exported, this will remove the subject names, emails, and student IDs from the dataset.

fields.title: Staff Control
fields.text:
Start Session: Starts the session, and the subject screens will switch to the first phase of the experiment.

Continue Session: Once all subjects have (optionally) completed the instructions, start the experiment. Instruction status is located in the Subjects table. The instructions will be hidden and the first period will start.

Refresh Clients: If the experiment fails to advance, refreshing the clients will try to advance the session to the next period or part.

Reset Connection Status: Sets all client connection statuses to "disconnected".  Note that this will not disconnect any connected clients this only changes the status.  This will re-open all clients to auto connection.

Reset Session:  Remove all data and reset the experiment back to the pre-start state.

Send Invitations:  Send an email to any subjects that have an email defined.  The email will contain their private login link.
